definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to move (i.e. relocate oneself)/to move (sth relatively heavy or bulky)/to shift/to copy indiscriminately
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
is/are/am/yes/to be
abbr. for 非洲[Fei1 zhou1], Africa
to not be/not/wrong/incorrect/non-/un-/in-/to reproach or blame/(colloquial) to insist on/simply must

sentences.english: Gossiping and lying go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 搬弄是非者，必是撒謊人。

sentences.english: He shouldn't have carried tales among his comrades.
sentences.chinese: 他不該在同志們之間搬弄是非。

sentences.english: A tattler is worse than a thief.
sentences.chinese: 搬弄是非者，惡劣甚於賊。

sentences.english: Unlike your Indian friends, I don't poke my nose in the affairs of India.
sentences.chinese: 跟你們印度朋友不同，我不對印度事務搬弄是非。

sentences.english: But the world is so censorious no character escapes.
sentences.chinese: 但世人就是這麼愛搬弄是非，無人倖免。

sentences.english: I have had enough of her gossips.
sentences.chinese: 我聽夠了她的搬弄是非的話。

sentences.english: The venom of rattlesnake is enough to kill 1000 rats.
sentences.chinese: 搬弄是非者的毒舌比響尾蛇的毒液還要致命。

sentences.english: She deals in gossip and slander.
sentences.chinese: 她常搬弄是非和造謠中傷。

sentences.english: Aren't they cute? But they can be dangerous, even when they're not gossiping about each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們很聰明，但可能很危險，儘管他們沒有搬弄是非。

sentences.english: She wanted to sow discord between us.
sentences.chinese: 她想在我們中間搬弄是非。

sentences.english: I would hate you to think me a troublemaker.
sentences.chinese: 我不願你認爲我是個搬弄是非的人。

sentences.english: I hxdye had enough of her gossips.
sentences.chinese: 我聽夠了她的搬弄是非的話。

sentences.english: A deceitful witness that uttereth lies, and him that soweth discord among brethren.
sentences.chinese: 說謊的假見證，和在兄弟間搬弄是非的人。

sentences.english: Avoid a questioner, for he is also a tattler.
sentences.chinese: 避免與好探人隱私，搬弄是非之人在一起。

definition: to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
to start rumours and create trouble
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
lit. to discuss sb's merits and demerits (idiom); to gossip
to make trouble out of nothing
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
female gossip/busybody
to gossip/to argue unnecessarily
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to make thoughtless remarks (idiom)/to criticize/gossip
narrow/petty-minded
lit. honeyed words, a sword in the belly (idiom); fig. hypocritical and murderous
to provoke
